title: devboard
description: Devboard is a project template built with Next.js 14 utilizing the Pages Router for quick prototyping and development. Leveraging TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, it incorporates best practices for front-end architecture, including Material UI (MUI) for UI components and React Query for efficient data fetching and caching. This repository serves as a foundation for new web applications, demonstrating effective integration of modern technologies within the Next.js ecosystem.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project utilizing HTML and Python to create interactive and informative map visualizations. This repository contains the code and resources necessary to generate maps that effectively display spatial data and trends, focusing on presenting data in a clear and engaging manner through visual representations.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a Python-based CRUD application built with Flask, providing a user interface via HTML, CSS, and Shell scripts. It leverages PostgreSQL for data storage and demonstrates a complete project implementation covering topics like CRUD operations, web framework development, and database integration in Python.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-debt-tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users track and manage their sleep debt. This tool allows for easy logging of sleep schedules and provides insightful visualizations to understand sleep patterns and identify areas for improvement. The project leverages TypeScript to ensure code maintainability and scalability while providing a user-friendly experience.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a modern web application boilerplate built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to serve as a foundation for building complex dashboards and admin panels. It provides a robust starting point for projects, demonstrating best practices in front-end architecture and component design within the realm of general web development projects.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that provides a modern and user-friendly platform for creating and participating in polls and voting events. This repository contains the codebase for managing voting sessions, handling user input, and displaying real-time results, all while focusing on a clean and efficient user experience.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a user-friendly web interface for monitoring and interacting with the Robofleet robotic fleet management system. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, the dashboard offers real-time data visualization, remote control capabilities, and comprehensive status reports, facilitating efficient management and oversight of robotic operations within the context of the overall project.

title: resume
description: This repository contains my resume, built using LaTeX for professional formatting and potentially incorporating HTML for online presentation or interactive elements. It serves as a central project for maintaining and showcasing my professional experience and skills.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log data. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, this project offers a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and display ROS logs, facilitating easier debugging and performance monitoring of ROS-based robotics systems.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a web-based project utilizing JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to create a visually appealing and interactive event calendar. This repository contains the code for building a dynamic calendar that allows users to view, manage, and potentially interact with events within a user-friendly interface, focusing on practical application and showcasing front-end development skills.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase for efficient IoT asset management. This repository provides a modern web application demonstrating real-time tracking, data visualization, and user authentication, leveraging the power of serverless functions and a scalable database solution.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript to create a dynamic and collaborative platform for brainstorming, organizing, and prioritizing ideas. Built with a modern frontend framework, this application facilitates idea generation and management, making it ideal for project planning, team collaboration, and personal knowledge management.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a web application built with TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, HTML, Vite.js, and Express.js that leverages the Gemini API to provide an engaging conversational AI experience. This project demonstrates a practical implementation of integrating the Gemini API into a modern web framework, showcasing best practices for TypeScript development and server-side logic with Express.js.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built with Jupyter Notebook and Python, contains a collection of projects focused on applying Python to various finance-related tasks. It explores practical implementations of financial modeling, data analysis, and algorithmic trading strategies, providing hands-on examples for learning and experimentation in the field of finance using Python.

title: fruit-seller
description: fruit-seller is an e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 and the Pages Router, leveraging TypeScript for strong typing and React Query for efficient data fetching. This repository showcases a modern web application architecture using MUI for the UI components, and demonstrates best practices for building type-safe and performant user experiences in the context of online retail.
